title: Multilingual != Multicultural: Evaluating Gaps Between Multilingual Capabilities and Cultural Alignment in LLMs
author: Jonathan Rystrøm (Oxford Internet Institute, University of Oxford), Hannah Rose Kirk (Oxford Internet Institute, University of Oxford), Scott Hale (Oxford Internet Institute, University of Oxford), ...
relevance_why: The methodologies presented in this paper can inform future work in audio-language models, particularly regarding how to assess and align cultural values in generated audio and text.
background: This study investigates how well large language models align with cultural values across multiple languages, revealing discrepancies between multilingual capabilities and cultural alignment.
contribution: This paper introduces a novel statistical methodology for evaluating cultural alignment of language models using data from the World Values Survey, providing insights into the biases in model outputs.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods primarily focused on single model analyses in English contexts or non-statistical survey comparisons.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work differs by applying a rigorous statistical framework to compare language models against population-level cultural values across multiple languages.

key_innovation: Develops a distribution-based approach to measure how closely the values represented by language models correspond to actual cultural values in the surveyed populations.
real_world_impact: The findings raise awareness of the need for cultural sensitivity in AI applications, which could enhance the fairness and effectiveness of language technology in diverse global contexts.
limitations: Low self-consistency scores across language models suggest significant room for improvement in cultural representation.

new_terms.cultural alignment: **Cultural alignment** refers to the degree to which the outputs of a model reflect the values and beliefs of a particular cultural group.
new_terms.value polarity score: **Value polarity score** is a measure of the proportion of individuals in a population who hold a positive or negative stance on a specific issue.

open_sourcing: The dataset of model-generated responses and the code for the analysis are available at https://github.com/jhrystrom/multiculturalalignment
